cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:RegulatingControl has been potentially disabled with a large cim:RegulatingControl.targetDeadband

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: WindingConnectionAngle
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The cim:PhaseTapChangerAsymmetrical.windingConnectionAngle attribute in real grids can only have the following values - +/-150 - +/-120 - +/-90 - +/-60 - +/-30
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Asymmetrical phase tap changers are built for one of these connection angles.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Asymmetrical phase tap changers are built for one of the connection angles listed in Details

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: VoltageLimitDirection
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: A cim:VoltageLimit should be specified with a direction high or low, i.e. the cim:OperatinalLimitType.direction value should be one of - cim:OperationalLimitDirectionKind.high - cim:OperationalLimitDirectionKind.low
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: If the direction is missing it is not possible to check the voltage value.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:OperatinalLimitType.direction is missing

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: VoltageLimitsConsistency
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: cim:VoltageLimit within a given cim:OperationalLimitSet with direction cim:OperationalLimitDirectionKind.high should be greater than cim:VoltageLimit with direction cim:OperationalLimitDirectionKind.low.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: cim:VoltageLimit not consistent with the specified direction are meaningless.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:VoltageLimit values are not consistent with the specified directions

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: FlowLimitsDirectionConsistency
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Branch flow limits cim:CurrentLimit, cim:ApparentPowerLimit and cim:ActivePowerLimit should have a cim:OperatinalLimitType.direction with value cim:OperationalLimitDirectionKind.absoluteValue.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Branch flow can go in both directions on the branch. Hence the direction should be specified as an absoluteValue.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Branch flow limits with other direction than absoluteValue

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: AsymmetricalEquivalent
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: cim:EquivalentBranch with EquivalentBranch.r not qual to EquivalentBranch.r21 and EquivalentBranch.x not qual to EquivalentBranch.x21 shouldn't be used.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Equivalents with different impedance in different directions may result in poor convergence, hence reporting the difference support error tracing in data.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:EquivalentBranch with asymmetrical impedances

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: PositiveTransformerB
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Two-winding transformer with positive shunt (cim:PowerTransformerEnd.b > 0) that are not equivalenced (cim:Equipment.aggregate = false) shouldn't have positive PowerTransformerEnd.b.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Two winding transformers are reactive and should not have positive cim:PowerTransformerEnd.b
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Two winding transformer with positive shunt

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SubLoadAreaMissing
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The reference cim:LoadGroup->cim:SubLoadArea is required. The class cim:LoadGroup in in EQ core while cim:SubLoadArea is in operation. Hence a BB model using classes cim:ConformLoad and cim:NonConformLoad will get an error if cim:SubLoadArea instances are missing. As a CGM may contain both NB and BB models the cardinality for the BB models need to be 0..1 but for the NB models 1. This is solved by making the reference cim:LoadGroup->cim:SubLoadArea optional and have this rule checking that NB models do have the references.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: This is a bug fix of CGMES2.4.15.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: The reference cim:LoadGroup->cim:SubLoadArea is missing

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: EnergyAreaMissing
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The reference cim:ControlArea->cim:EnergyArea is required for NB models but not for BB models.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Required for NB models according to diagram note in CGMES2.4.15.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: The reference cim:ControlArea->cim:EnergyArea is missing

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: GeneratingUnitSM
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: A cim:GeneratingUnit or any of its subclasses is not allowed to have more than one cim:SynchronousMachine.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Having more than one cim:SynchronousMachine with a cim:GeneratingUnit will make active and reactive limits dynamically dependent of the number of operational cim:SynchronousMachines which makes scheduling difficult as this information is missing.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: A cim:GeneratingUnit is not allowed to have more than one cim:SynchronousMachine

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: TPBD->EQBD
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Every TPBD file shall have an 'md:Model.DependentOn' reference to the EQBD file.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement HREF2: "Dependent IDs refer to IDs of the dependent files at the time of the export". IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement PROF10.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Invalid md:Model.DependentOn statement(s) in TPBD

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: EQ->EQBD
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Every EQ file shall have an 'md:Model.DependentOn' reference to the EQBD file that was used for the serialization.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement HREF2: "Dependent IDs refer to IDs of the dependent files at the time of the export". IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement PROF10.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Invalid md:Model.DependentOn statement(s) in EQ

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: TP->EQ,TP->EQDIFF
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Every TP file shall have an 'md:Model.DependentOn' reference to a EQ or EQDIFF file. Note: This is a minimum requirement so more references may be present.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement HREF2: "Dependent IDs refer to IDs of the dependent files at the time of the export". IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement PROF10.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Invalid md:Model.DependentOn statement(s) in TP

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SSH->EQ,SSH->EQDIFF
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Every SSH file shall have an 'md:Model.DependentOn' reference to a EQ or EQDIFF file. Note: This is a minimum requirement so more references may be present.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement HREF2: "Dependent IDs refer to IDs of the dependent files at the time of the export". IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement PROF10.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Invalid md:Model.DependentOn statement(s) in SSH

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: DY->EQ,DY->EQDIFF
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Every DY file shall have an 'md:Model.DependentOn' reference to a EQ or EQDIFF file. Note: This is a minimum requirement so more references may be present.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement HREF2: "Dependent IDs refer to IDs of the dependent files at the time of the export". IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement PROF10.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Invalid md:Model.DependentOn statement(s) in DY

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SV->SSH,SV->TP,SV->TPBD
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Every SV file shall have 'md:Model.DependentOn' references to the files - SSH input files to the power flow calculation. - TP files with the power flow busses used in the power flow calculation. - TPBD files with the power flow busses in the boundary Note: This is a minimum requirement so more references may be present.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement HREF2: "Dependent IDs refer to IDs of the dependent files at the time of the export". IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement PROF10.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Invalid md:Model.DependentOn statement(s), SV must have reference to TP, SSH and TPBD (used as input data for the power flow calculations)

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: GL->EQ,GL->EQBD
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Every GL model file has 'md:Model.DependentOn' references to the EQ model file and EQBD model file that were used for the serialization. The reference to the EQ model file is required and EQBD model file is optional. Note: This is a minimum requirement so more references may be present.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement HREF2: "Dependent IDs refer to IDs of the dependent files at the time of the export". IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement PROF10.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Invalid md:Model.DependentOn statement(s), GL must have reference to EQ

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: DL->EQ,DL->EQDIFF,DL->TP,DL->DY
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Every DL file shall have 'md:Model.DependentOn' references to the EQ or EQDIFF file, the TP file and to the DY file that were used for the serialization. The reference to the EQ model file is required and the refereces to TP and DY model files are optional. Note: This is a minimum requirement so more references may be present.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement HREF2: "Dependent IDs refer to IDs of the dependent files at the time of the export". IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017, requirement PROF10.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Invalid md:Model.DependentOn statement(s), DL must have reference to EQ

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: EQDIFF->EQ
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Every EQDIFF file shall only have a md:Model.Supersedes references to the EQ file it updates as it is not correct to use md:Model.DependentOn for a CIMXML file that replaces or supersedes another. The elements of the following types are allowed in the EQDIFF document - cim:VoltageLimit - cim:CurrentLimit - cim:ActivePowerLimit - cim:ApparentPowerLimit This rule restricts use of difference models and is CGM_BP specific.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017 annex C.2. EMF meeting decision in Rome 2018-10-05.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Invalid md:Model.Supersedes statement(s), reference to EQ only allowed

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: EQDIFFOperationalLimit
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: An EQDIFF file is only allowed to contain subclasses of OperationalLimit. This is a temporary solution for exchange of limit values in EQ that in the future will be in SHH. This rule restricts use of difference models and is CGM_BP specific.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017 annex C.2. EMF meeting decision in Rome 2018-10-05.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Not allowed CIM class in EQDIFF file

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: DanglingReference
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The CGMES requires that at the receiving end of the exchange all references in the instance files pointing to instance files from other profiles which are part of the exchange should be satisfied. Therefore, the complete set of instance files necessary for the grid model must have fulfilled references (no dangling references are allowed). The mRID specified in every rdf:resource attribute in the assembly of cimxml instance files has been defined in an existing rdf:ID, rdf:about or enumeration.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: See IEC/TS 61970-600-1:2017 Requirement FBOD4
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Dangling reference found

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: IncorrectAttributeOrRoleCard
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: All mandatory attributes and associations must be provided for the assembled model according to cardinalities given by profiles specified in md:Model.profile for each of the assembled CIMXML files.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: See IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017 Requirement PROF5 and PROF7.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Cardinality violated for attribute or role, too many or too few values or references provided

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: CgmSvSshVersionMismatch
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: A CGM will have updated SSH files (referencing to original data by Supersede statement) for each IGM and a single SV file with the complete solution for the included IGMs. The updated SSH CIMXML files and the resulting CIMXML SV file should have the same - md:Model.scenarioTime. - a new md:Model.version number that is the same for the SV and SSH CIMXML files. In the case an IGM have invalid SV, SSH or TP CIMXML files for a md:Model.scenarioTime they will not be availalble from OPDM. These files may then be substituted with files having another md:Model.scenarioTime than the time for which the study is made. The SSH and TP CIMXML files used in the replacement are given the md:Model.scenarioTime for the study which is different from the md:Model.scenarioTime in the original CIMXML files which is one reason for differences between md:Model.scenarioTimes.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Versioning of CGM is important for sustainable CGM building process.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Different fileVersion or effectiveDateTime in SSH and SV from CGM

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: GeographicalRegionBD
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: cim:GeographicalRegions should be agreed on by modeling authorities and be described in the equipment boundary. The cim:GeographicalRegion name should be the same as the modeling authority names described in level 1 rule ModelingAuthority.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: cim:GeographicalRegion is used to organise equipment geographically and regions that corresponds to a network model managed by a TSO which is also the ModelingAuthority for the network.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:GeographicalRegion not in boundary

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: GeographicalRegion
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: An IGM shall have a single cim:GeographicalRegion.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: cim:GeographicalRegion is used to organise equipment geographically and regions that corresponds to a network model managed by a TSO which is also the ModelingAuthority for the network. Each IGM shall be described by one cim:GeographicalRegion. See also IEC TS 61970-600-1 E.13.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: More than one GeographicalRegion in IGM

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: LineContainment
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:ACLineSegment, the cim:Equipment.EquipmentContainer referred to, if provided, must be of type cim:Line
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: See Figure 15 (diagram Core notes) and section 6.9.16 of IEC TS 61970-600-2
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:ACLineSegments can only be contained in a cim:Line

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: EquivalentInjectionContainment
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Every cim:EquivalentInjection shall be contained by a - cim:VoltageLevel if not in a boundary point. - If in a boundary point, preferably it is contained in a cim:Line or not contained at all with provided association to cim:BaseVoltage.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: All equipment shall be contained, also cim:EquivalentInjection, but as it is allowed not to have cim:EquivalentInjection contained this is allowed for backwards compatibility. See also IEC TS 61970-600-2 6.7.6.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:EquivalentInjection containment error

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: DCLineContainment
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:DCLineSegment, the cim:Equipment.EquipmentContainer referred to, must be of type cim:DCLine. Missing containment is not allowed.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: See section 6.3.15 of IEC TS 61970-600-2
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:DCLineSegment must be contained in a cim:DCLine

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: BaseVoltageNotInBoundary
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: All cim:BaseVoltages should be agreed on by modeling authorities and be in the boundary. If a matching base voltage is already in the boundary it should be used. If a matching base voltage is not in the boundary consider to add it in the boundary so that it can be reused by others.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: An agreement on the base voltages is required to get interoperability. Rule added at CGM_BP meeting in Zagreb 2019-05-23.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:BaseVoltage not in boundary

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SVCVoltage
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The control variables in an SVC are duplicate with RequlatingControl. The RequlatingControl values are used, not the SVC values. The following values are used: - RequlatingControl.targetValue, must be greater than zero if voltage control - RequlatingControl.enabled - RequlatingControl.mode - RequlatingControl.Terminal, for the controlled point
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The reactive power output of the SVC is proportional to the difference between the voltage at the regulated bus and the voltage setpoint. When the regulated bus voltage is equal to the voltage setpoint, the reactive power output is zero. RequlatingControl is used as it has capabilities missing from SVC, e.g. the controlled point. See IEC TS 61970-600-2:2017, section 6.9.44
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: The voltage set point for a SVC must be positive

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: TapChangerNeutralU
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The cim:TapChanger.neutralU shall be the same as cim:PowerTransformerEnd.ratedU.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: See section E.2.2. of IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: The neutralU differs from ratedU

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: ControlLinkedToTopology
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The controlled cim:Terminal at a cim:RegulatingControl (RC) or cim:TapChangerControl (TCC) must be linkedto a cim:TopologicalNode (TN). In case cim:Switch cim:Terminals are not included in TP and if the controlled point is a cim:Switch cim:Terminal the controlled point is lost. The cardinality for cim:Terminal.TopologicalNode is 1 so it is required, hence all cim:Terminals must be present in TP regardless of the type of conducting equipment, it is linked to. This rule shouldn't be needed if all cim:Terminals where present in TP.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: If a RC or TCC is not linked to a TN the changes in the control variables will not affect the target value in the power flow calculation. See section E.12 of IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Terminal controlled by cim:RegulatingControl or cim:TapChangerControl is not linked to a cim:TopologicalNode

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: BranchBaseVoltage
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Every instance of cim:ACLineSegment or cim:EquivalentBranch must have an association cim:ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage. Every PowerTransformerEnd must have an association with cim:TransformerEnd.BaseVoltage.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: ACLineSegment, EquivalentBranch, SeriesCompensator or PowerTransformerEnd has no BaseVoltage

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: EquivalentInjectionControlEnabled
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Boundary cim:EquivalentInjections should have control disabled and cim:EquivalentInjection.regulationCapability should be false. An cim:EquivalentInjection may have control enabled only if it represents an HVDC converter. cim:EquivalentInjections that are result of network reduction may have control enabled, if so realistic reactive power limits shall be provided. Note: An HVDC Boundary Point has a cim:IdentifiedObject.description attribute equal to 'HVDC'
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Excessive reactive resources do not properly reflect power system behaviour.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Boundary cim:EquivalentInjections representing AC networks should not control voltage

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: NoLTCTapChangerControl
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: If cim:TapChanger.ltcFlag is false, no TapChangerControl object is referenced by cim:TapChanger.TapChangerControl.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: See section E.9.3. of IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: TapChangerControl found for TapChanger.step that cannot be changed under load

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SvTapStepInstances
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: A cim:SvTapStep instance is expected for all cim:TapChanger instances defined in EQ
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: See section E.9.3. of IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Missing SvTapStep for TapChanger

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SvPowerFlowInstances
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: cim:SvPowerFlow class is required to be instantiated for the following classes: - subclasses of the cim:RotatingMachine - subclasses of the cim:EnergyConsumer - cim:EquivalentInjection - cim:EquivalentNetworkInjection - cim:ShuntCompensator - cim:StaticVarCompensator - cim:EnergySource.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: See section 9.5.4 of IEC TS 61970-600-2
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Missing SvPowerFlow for Equipment

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SvPowerFlowBranchInstances
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For a boundary cim:TopologicalNode to be complete it shall have one cim:EquivalentInjection and one branch connected. Branches of the following types may connect - cim:ACLineSegment - cim:PowerTransformer - subtypes of cim:Switch. A cim:Switch shall be retained. Branches may have one cim:TieFlow connected to the branch cim:Terminal at the boundary point. Note: The cim:EquivalentInjection has an cim:SvPowerFlow according to rule SvPowerFlowInstances. Hence the branch flow can be picked up from the cim:SvPowerFlow with the sign changed.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The branch flows are used to check that the interchange match the tie flows. See BPPL1 of IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: The boundary cim:TopologicalNode is incomplete and is missing at least one of the following - a branch, e.g. cim:ACLineSegment, cim:PowerTransformer or cim:Switch - a TieFlow linked to the branch, present if the branch is a tie flow - an cim:EquivalentInjection

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SvPowerFlowBranchInstances2
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: cim:SvPowerFlow class is required to be instantiated for the following classes: - cim:SeriesCompensator - cim:ACLineSegment not required according to rule SvPowerFlowBranchInstances - cim:PowerTransformer not required according to rule SvPowerFlowBranchInstances - cim:Switch where cim:Switch.retained is true not required according to rule SvPowerFlowBranchInstances.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The power flow result for branches cannot be reviewed without cim:SvPowerFlow. This is needed when solutions for the same IGM or CGM computed by different tools are compared. Note that computing the flows by scripts based on solved voltages may not give the same result as the original power flow.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Missing cim:SvPowerFlow for branch

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: DisconnectedTerminal
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: If the associated cim:Terminal.connected status is false, the flow specified in the cim:SvPowerFlow.p and cim:SvPowerFlow.q shall be zero
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: See section 9.5.4. of IEC TS 61970-600-2
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Zero flow expected for disconnected terminal

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: TopologicalIslandInstance
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: In case a solved model is exchanged for a single MAS the state variables profile must include at least one instance of cim:TopologicalIsland
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: See section E.6 of IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Missing cim:TopologicalIsland

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SmallTopologicalIsland
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: A small cim:TopologicalIsland with TNs having zero voltage is in most cases meaningless and should not be exchanged. A cim:TopologicalIsland with three or fewer cim:TopologicalNodes is small.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: A small cim:TopologicalIsland is typically not energized and does not contribute to the interconnected network solution. The number of three cim:TopologicalNodes as a small island is selected to cath disconnected three winding transformers.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Small cim:TopologicalIsland found

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SlackNode
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every cim:TopologicalIsland the cim:TopologicalIsland.AngleRefTopologicalNode should refer to the cim:TopologicalNode with a cim:SynchronousMachine having the highest cim:SynchronousMachine.referencePriority. The priority values are - 0 not included in slack node determination. - 1 is the highest. - 2 and on are decreasing priorities. If no cim:SynchronousMachine with cim:SynchronousMachine.referencePriority specified is available the cim:TopologicalIsland.AngleRefTopologicalNode can be set to any cim:TopologicalNode.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: See section E.4 of IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017 If different power flow solutions have the same angle reference for the same network solutions are easier to compare. If not, the linear offset is to be expected.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: A cim:SynchronousMachine with valid ReferencePriority exists but is not used for defining the angle reference node in topological island

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SwitchTerminals
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:Switch, cim:Breaker, cim:Disconnector, cim:GroundDisconnector, cim:LoadBreakSwitch and cim:ProtectedSwitch, it is not allowed to have its cim:Terminals connected to the same cim:ConnectivityNode.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: See section E.17 of IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: A switch cannot have its terminals connect the same cim:ConnectivityNode

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SwitchVL
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:Switch, cim:Breaker, cim:Disconnector, cim:GroundDisconnector, cim:LoadBreakSwitch and cim:ProtectedSwitch, it is not allowed to connect cim:ConnectivityNode or cim:TopologicalNode in different cim:VoltageLevels.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: See section E.17 of IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: A cim:Switch cannot connect to cim:ConnectivityNodes or cim:TopologicalNodes in different cim:VoltageLevels

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SwitchTN1
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:Switch, cim:Breaker, cim:Disconnector, cim:GroundDisconnector, cim:LoadBreakSwitch and cim:ProtectedSwitch, with cim:Switch.retained is true, its cim:Terminals shall be associated with different cim:TopologicalNodes.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: See section E.17 of IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Retained cim:Switch cim:Terminals cannot be associated with the same cim:TopologicalNode

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SwitchOpenVsConnected
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: A cim:Terminal has switching capability due to the attribute cim:ACDCTerminal.connected flag. Equipment can be disconnected with this flag. For switches this means it is possible the break the conducting path at three places - cim:ACDCTerminal.connected side 1 - cim:Switch.open - cim:ACDCTerminal.connected side 2 Evaluating switch status then means inspecting the three flags for every switch. The attribute cim:Switch.open shall not conflict with the cim:Terminal connected statuses, hence the attribute cim:ACDCTerminal.connected shall always be true for instances of cim:Switches or its subclasses.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: A user need not consider cim:ACDCTerminal.connected.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:ACDCTerminal.connected is not true for a cim:Switch

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: ParticipatingGeneratingUnit
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: This rule applies when generation slack is used. As cim:GeneratingUnits do not have a link with cim:ControlArea generation slack can only be used for IGMs. cim:GeneratingUnits that pick-up mismatch shall have a cim:GeneratingUnit.normalPF greater than 0. At least one such unit is required in every electrical island.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: GeneratingUnits cannot pick-up mismatch if this data is unspecified.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: No GeneratingUnit with NormalPF > 0 in Island

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: ControlOfAnotherIsland
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: A cim:RegulatingControl or cim:TapChangerControl is controlling a cim:TopologicalNode in another cim:TopologicalIsland than its controlling equipment is located.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: There is no feedback loop to the control in this case.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: A controlled cim:TopologicalNode is in another cim:TopologicalIsland than the controlling equipment

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: TapChangerTargetRange
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: A tap changer cannot reach a cim:RegulatingControl.targetValue outside its capability. The tap changer upper capability limit in per unit is - TCUC = 1+cim:RatioTapChanger.stepVoltageIncrement/100* (cim:TapChanger.highStep-cim:TapChanger.neutralStep) The tap changer lower capability limit in per uit is - TCLC = 1-cim:RatioTapChanger.stepVoltageIncrement/100* (cim:TapChanger.neutralStep-cim:TapChanger.lowStep) The TCUC and TCLC are in per unit (PU) The target value in PU is TargetValuePU = cim:RegulatingControl.targetValue/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage where the cim:BaseVoltage is from the controlled Terminal. The rule is - min(TCLC,TCHC) GreaterOrEqual TargetValuePU LessOrEqual max(TCLC,TCHC) Note1: The cim:TapChanger.controlEnabled and cim:RequlatingControl.eanbled flags are to be considered. Note2: cim:TapChangerControlMode shall be set to voltage control.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The transformer cannot meet the requested target value.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: The cim:RegulatingControl.targetValue outside the cim:TapChanger capability

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: IDuniqueness
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: All mRIDs (rdf:ID or rdf:about) in a model shall be unique.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: All mRIDs (rdf:ID or rdf:about) shall be globally uniqe as stated in IEC 61970-552. See IEC TS 61970-600-1:2017 GENC1.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: mRID (rdf:ID or rdf:about) not unique within model

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: TCCRemoteReactiveFlow
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: A cim:TapChangerControl (TCC) controlling reactive power flow is only allowed to control the flow at one of the cim:Terminals belonging to cim:PowertransformerEnds in the cim:PowerTransformer where the cim:TapChanger is located. Control a remote cim:Terminal not belonging to the cim:PowerTransformer with the cim:TapChanger is not allowed. Note: A result of this is that multiple cim:TapChangers cannot be controlled by the same TCC.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: A power transformer cannot efficiently control reactive power flow other than on its own terminals.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: A cim:TapChangerControl for reactive power flow is controlling a cim:Terminal that is not connected to one of the cim:PowerTransformerEnd(s)

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SynchronousCondenserMode
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For a synchronous condenser (cim:SynchronousMachine.type = condenser) there is no capability for real power output. In this case, the cim:SynchronousMachine.operationMode should be condenser.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The name plate ratings are used as a reference. See IEC TS 61970-600-2:2017, section 6.9.47.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: A synchronous condenser shhould have cim:SynchronousMachine.operatingMode set to condenser

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SCSections
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:ShuntCompensator, cim:LinearShuntCompensator and cim:NonLinearShuntCompensator, the value of cim:ShuntCompensator.sections should be lower than or equal to the value of cim:ShuntCompensator.maximumSections.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Number of sections out of range

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: GenActivePowerInfeedLim
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The negated value of cim:RotatingMachine.p should be smaller than or equal to cim:GeneratingUnit.maxOperatingP and must be greater than or equal to cim:GeneratingUnit.minOperatingP of the associated generating unit. Note1: Negation is necessary due to the load sign convention. Note2: A SM with cim:RotatingMachine.p = 0 is considered out of service.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Load sign convention is used for the power infeed, whereas nameplate ratings are used for the operating limits.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Generation active power infeed out of range

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: GenActivePowerInfeedDiffW
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:SynchronousMachine, the value of cim:RotatingMachine.p should not deviate more than SSH_SV_MAX_P_DIFF MW from the value of cim:SvPowerFlow.p for the associated terminal. Note that disconnected synchronous machines should have zero values in SSH.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The SSH data should be based on a solved power flow (CGMM) and as a consequence, the values in SSH (input) and SV (calculation results) should not be far away.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Assumed generation infeed cim:SynchronousMachine deviates from calculated generation infeed more than SSH_SV_MAX_P_DIFF

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: GenActivePowerInfeedDiffE
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The aggregated sum of the values of cim:RotatingMachine.p shall not deviate more than SSH_SV_TOT_P_DIFF MW from the aggregated sum of the values of cim:SvPowerFlow.p for the terminals connected to synchronous machines. Note that disconnected synchronous machines should have zero values in SSH.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The SSH data should be based on a solved power flow (CGMM) and as a consequence, the values in SSH (input) and SV (calculation results) should not be far away.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Assumed aggregated active power generation infeed deviates from calculated generation infeed more than SSH_SV_TOT_P_DIFF MW

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: GenReactivePowerInfeedDiffW
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:SynchronousMachine, the value of cim:RotatingMachine.q should not deviate more than SSH_SV_MAX_Q_DIFF MVAr from the value of cim:SvPowerFlow.q for the associated terminal. Note that disconnected synchronous machines should have zero values in SSH.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Considering the Power Flow settings, the reactive power shift should be minimal.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Potential reactive power problem located for cim:SynchronousMachine, assumed reactive power generation of cim:SynchronousMachine deviates from calculated more than SSH_SV_MAX_Q_DIFF MVAr

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: GenReactivePowerInfeedLim
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The reactive power provided to the network by a cim:SynchronousMachine shall stay within limits regardless if it is controlling or not - negated cim:RotatingMachine.q greater or equal than cim:SynchronousMachine.minQ if provided - negated cim:RotatingMachine.q less or equal than cim:SynchronousMachine.maxQ if provided Note1: cim:RotatingMachine.q shall be negated due to the load sign convention.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The reactive power infeed at PQ nodes should be within limits
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Generation reactive power infeed out of range

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: GenRCCPowerInfeed
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The power provided to the network by a cim:SynchronousMachine shall stay within limits regardless if it is controlling or not. This rule applies when a reactive capability curve is present. Active power is restricted as - RCCCD = RCC.mRID=CD[CD.Curve] - -RM.p LE max(RCCCD/CD.xvalue) and - -RM.p GE min(RCCCD/CD.xvalue) where - The notation above is an XPath expression - RCC = cim:ReactiveCapabilityCurve - RCCD = The cim:CurveData points that belongs to the RCC - CD = cim:CurveData - RM = cim:RotatingMachine, note this is load sign convention - LE = Less or Equal - GE = Greater or Equal Reactive power is restricted as - CD1 = min(RCCD[CD.xvalue LE RM.p]) - CD2 = min(RCCD[CD.xvalue GE RM.p]) - RM.q LE interpolate(CD2/CD.y2value, CD2/CD.xvalue, CD1/CD.y2value, CD1/CD.xvalue, RM.p) - RM.q GE interpolate(CD2/CD.y1value, CD2/CD.xvalue, CD1/CD.y1value, CD1/CD.xvalue, RM.p) where - CD1 = nearest lower active power limit point - CD2 = nearest higher active power limit point - interpolate(w1, z1, w2, z2, w) is a fuction with parameters - w1 and z1 = the first coordinate point - w2 and z2 = the second coordinate point - w = the value along the w axis to interpolate the value along the z axis In case interpolation is not used, the mean value between w1 and w2 should be used as limit.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The active and reactive power infeed at PQ nodes should be within limits
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Generation reactive power infeed out of range

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: ValidDER
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of a DistributedEnergyResource (DER), e.g. cim:EnergySource, the value of cim:EnergySource.activePower should be lower than or equal to zero.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Due to the load sign convention, decentralized infeed must be negative or zero. See IEC TS 61970-600-2:2017 section 7.8.6.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: DER infeed acts as a load

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: DERActivePowerInfeedDiffW
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:EnergySource, the value of cim:EnergySource.activePower should not deviate more than SSH_SV_MAX_P_DIFF MW from the value of cim:SvPowerFlow.p for the associated terminal. Note that disconnected DER should have zero values in SSH.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The SSH data should be based on a solved power flow (CGMM) and as a consequence, the values in SSH (input) and SV (calculation results) should not be far away.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Assumed generation infeed of cim:EnergySource deviates from calculated generation infeed more than SSH_SV_MAX_P_DIFF MW

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: DERActivePowerInfeedDiffE
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The aggregated sum of the values of cim:EnergySource.activePower shall not deviate more than SSH_SV_TOT_P_DIFF MW from the aggregated sum of the values of cim:SvPowerFlow.p for the terminals connected to synchronous machines. Note that disconnected DER should have zero values in SSH.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The SSH data should be based on a solved power flow (CGMM) and as a consequence, the values in SSH (input) and SV (calculation results) should not be far away.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Assumed aggregated active power generation infeed deviates from calculated generation infeed more than SSH_SV_TOT_P_DIFF MW

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: DERReactivePowerInfeedDiffW
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:EnergySource, the value of cim:EnergySource.reactivePower should not deviate more than SSH_SV_MAX_Q_DIFF MVAr from the value of cim:SvPowerFlow.q for the associated terminal. Note that disconnected DER should have zero values in SSH.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The SSH data should be based on a solved power flow (CGMM) and as a consequence, the values in SSH (input) and SV (calculation results) should not be far away.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Assumed generation infeed of cim:EnergySource deviates from calculated generation infeed more than SSH_SV_MAX_Q_DIFF MVAr

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: ValidLoad
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:StationSupply, cim:ConformLoad and cim:NonConformLoad, the value of cim:EnergyConsumer.p should be greater than or equal to zero
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Due to the load sign convention, all loads should be positive or zero. Decentralized generation should be modelled explicitly. See IEC TS 61970-600-2:2017 section 7.8.5.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Load infeed acts as a generator

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: LoadActivePowerInfeedDiffW
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:StationSupply, cim:ConformLoad and cim:NonConformLoad, the value of cim:EnergyConsumer.p should not deviate more than SSH_SV_MAX_P_DIFF MW from the value of cim:SvPowerFlow.p for the associated terminal. Note that disconnected loads should have zero values in SSH.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The SSH data should be based on a solved power flow (CGMM) and as a consequence, the values in SSH (input) and SV (calculation results) should not be far away.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Assumed consumption deviates from calculated consumption more than SSH_SV_MAX_P_DIFF MW

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: LoadActivePowerInfeedDiffE
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The aggregated sum of the values of cim:EnergyConsumer.p shall not deviate more than SSH_SV_TOT_P_DIFF MW from the aggregated sum of the values of cim:SvPowerFlow.p for the associated terminals. Note that disconnected loads should have zero values in SSH.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The SSH data should be based on a solved power flow (CGMM) and as a consequence, the values in SSH (input) and SV (calculation results) should not be far away.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Assumed aggregated consumption deviates from calculated consumption more than SSH_SV_TOT_P_DIFF MW

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: LoadReactivePowerInfeedDiffW
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:StationSupply, cim:ConformLoad and cim:NonConformLoad, the value of cim:EnergyConsumer.q should not deviate more than SSH_SV_MAX_Q_DIFF MVAr from the value of cim:SvPowerFlow.q for the associated terminal. Note that disconnected loads should have zero values in SSH.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Considering the Power Flow settings, the reactive power shift should be minimal.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Potential reactive power problem located for load instance, assumed reactive power deviates from calculated more than SSH_SV_MAX_Q_DIFF MVAr

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: ENIActivePowerInfeedLim
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The negated value of cim:ExternalNetworkInjection.p should be smaller than or equal to cim:ExternalNetworkInjection.maxP and must be greater than or equal to cim:ExternalNetworkInjection.minP. Note1: Negation is necessary due to the load sign convention. Note2: An instance with cim:ExternalNetworkInjection.p = 0 is considered out of service.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Load sign convention is used for the power infeed, whereas nameplate ratings are used for the operating limits.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: ExternalNetworkInjection active power infeed out of range

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: ENIReactivePowerInfeedLim
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The negated value of cim:ExternalNetworkInjection.q should be smaller than or equal to cim:ExternalNetworkInjection.maxQ and must be greater than or equal to cim:ExternalNetworkInjection.minQ. Note1: Negation is necessary due to the load sign convention.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Load sign convention is used for the power infeed, whereas nameplate ratings are used for the operating limits.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: ExternalNetworkInjection reactive power infeed out of range

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: ENIActivePowerInfeedDiffW
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:ExternalNetworkInjection, the value of cim:ExternalNetworkInjection.p should not deviate more than SSH_SV_MAX_P_DIFF MW from the value of cim:SvPowerFlow.p for the associated terminal
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The SSH data should be based on a solved power flow (CGMM) and as a consequence, the values in SSH (input) and SV (calculation results) should not be far away. Note: cim:ExternalNetworkInjection should not be used frequently considering its purpose.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Assumed external injection deviates from calculated more than SSH_SV_MAX_P_DIFF MW

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: ENIActivePowerInfeedDiffE
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The aggregated sum of the values of cim:ExternalNetworkInjection.p shall not deviate more than SSH_SV_TOT_P_DIFF MW from the aggregated sum of the values of cim:SvPowerFlow.p for the associated terminals
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The SSH data should be based on a solved power flow (CGMM) and as a consequence, the values in SSH (input) and SV (calculation results) should not be far away. Note: cim:ExternalNetworkInjection should not be used frequently considering its purpose.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Assumed aggregated sum of external injections deviates from calculated more than SSH_SV_TOT_P_DIFF MW

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: ENIReactivePowerInfeedDiffW
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every cim:ExternalNetworkInjection the value of cim:ExternalNetworkInjection.q should not deviate more than SSH_SV_MAX_Q_DIFF MVAr from the value of cim:SvPowerFlow.q for the associated terminal. Note that disconnected loads should have zero values in SSH.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Considering the Power Flow settings, the reactive power shift should be minimal.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Potential reactive power problem located for cim:ExternalNetworkInjection, assumed reactive power deviates from calculated more than SSH_SV_MAX_Q_DIFF MVAr

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: EIActivePowerInfeedLim
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The negated value of non-boundary cim:EquivalentInjection.p should be smaller than or equal to cim:EquivalentInjection.maxP and greater than or equal to cim:EquivalentInjection.minP. Note1: Negation is necessary due to the load sign convention. Note2: An instance with cim:EquivalentInjection.p = 0 is considered out of service.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Load sign convention is used for the power infeed, whereas nameplate ratings are used for the operating limits.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: EquivalentInjection active power infeed out of range

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: EIReactivePowerInfeedLim
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The negated value of non-boundary cim:EquivalentInjection.q should be smaller than or equal to cim:EquivalentInjection.maxQ and must be greater than or equal to ccim:EquivalentInjection.minQ. Note1: Negation is necessary due to the load sign convention.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Load sign convention is used for the power infeed, whereas nameplate ratings are used for the operating limits.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: EquivalentInjection reactive power infeed out of range

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: EIActivePowerInfeedDiffW
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every non-boundary cim:EquivalentInjection, the value of cim:EquivalentInjection.p should not deviate more than SSH_SV_MAX_P_DIFF MW from the value of cim:SvPowerFlow.p for the associated terminal
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The SSH data should be based on a solved power flow (CGMM) and as a consequence, the values in SSH (input) and SV (calculation results) should not be far away. Note: cim:EquivalentInjection should not be used frequently considering its purpose.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Assumed non-boundary cim:EquivalentInjection injection deviates from calculated more than SSH_SV_MAX_P_DIFF MW

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: EIActivePowerInfeedDiffE
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The aggregated sum of the values of non-boundary cim:EquivalentInjection.p shall not deviate more than SSH_SV_TOT_P_DIFF MW from the aggregated sum of the values of cim:SvPowerFlow.p for the associated terminals
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The SSH data should be based on a solved power flow (CGMM) and as a consequence, the values in SSH (input) and SV (calculation results) should not be far away. Note: cim:EquivalentInjection should not be used frequently considering its purpose.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Assumed non-boundary cim:EquivalentInjection aggregated injection deviates from calculated more than SSH_SV_TOT_P_DIFF MW

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: EIReactivePowerInfeedDiffW
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The reactive power provided to the network by a non-boundary cim:EquivalentInjection shall stay within limits regardless if it is controlling or not - cim:EquivalentInjection.q greater or equal than cim:EquivalentInjection.minQ if provided and - cim:EquivalentInjection.q less or equal than cim:EquivalentInjection.maxQ if provided
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The reactive power infeed at PQ nodes should be within limits.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:EquivalentInjection reactive power infeed out of range

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: NetInterchange1
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For a cim:ControlArea of type interchange the aggregated sum of the values of cim:SvPowerFlow.p for cim:Terminals referenced by cim:TieFlow.Terminal shall not deviate from the value of cim:ControlArea.netInterchange with more than cim:ControlArea.pTolerance. Implications from other rules to consider; 1) According to level 5 rule SvPowerFlowBranchInstances the cim:Terminal referenced by a cim:TieFlow.Terminal is located at a boundary cim:TopologicalNode, hence the attribute cim:TieFlow.positiveFlowIn is always true. 2) According to level 5 rule SvPowerFlowBranchInstances the cim:Terminal referenced by cim:TieFlow.Terminal is not required to have a cim:SvPowerFlow. 3) According to level 5 rule SvPowerFlowInstances every cim:EquivalentInjection has a cim:SvPowerFlow. A concequence is that the cim:SvPowerFlow at the cim:EquivalentInjection cim:Terminal must be used in the summation but with negated value. The cim:EquivalentInjection cim:Terminal is at the same boundary cim:TopologicalNode as the cim:Terminal refenced by cim:TieFlow.Terminal. If pTolerance is not available or greater than INTERCH_IMBALANCE_WARNING MW, a threshold or INTERCH_IMBALANCE_WARNING MW is used. Note1: cim:ControlArea.netInterchange include AC and DC exchanges. Note2: An HVDC Boundary TopologicalNode has a cim:IdentifiedObject.description attribute with leading characters 'HVDC'.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Area interchange control uses ControlArea.netInterchange as set point, the TieFlow terminals as State Variables and the ConformLoad within the ControlArea as Control Variables.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Netted Area position not respected more than INTERCH_IMBALANCE_WARNING MW

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: NetInterchange2
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For a cim:ControlArea of type interchange the aggregated sum of the values of cim:SvPowerFlow.p for cim:Terminals referenced by cim:TieFlow.Terminal shall not deviate from the value of cim:ControlArea.netInterchange with more than INTERCH_IMBALANCE_ERROR MW. Implications from other rules to consider; 1) According to level 5 rule SvPowerFlowBranchInstances the cim:Terminal referenced by a cim:TieFlow.Terminal is located at a boundary cim:TopologicalNode, hence the attribute cim:TieFlow.positiveFlowIn is always true. 2) According to level 5 rule SvPowerFlowBranchInstances the cim:Terminal referenced by cim:TieFlow.Terminal is not required to have a cim:SvPowerFlow. 3) According to level 5 rule SvPowerFlowInstances every cim:EquivalentInjection has a cim:SvPowerFlow. A concequence is that the cim:SvPowerFlow at the cim:EquivalentInjection cim:Terminal must be used in the summation but with negated value. The cim:EquivalentInjection cim:Terminal is at the same boundary cim:TopologicalNode as the cim:Terminal refenced by cim:TieFlow.Terminal. Note1: cim:ControlArea.netInterchange include AC and DC exchanges. Note2: An HVDC Boundary TopologicalNode has a cim:IdentifiedObject.description attribute with leading characters 'HVDC'.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Area interchange control uses ControlArea.netInterchange as set point, the TieFlow terminals as State Variables and the ConformLoad within the ControlArea as Control Variables.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Netted Area position severely not respected. for more than INTERCH_IMBALANCE_ERROR MW

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: TapPosition
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:RatioTapChanger, cim:PhaseTapChangerLinear, cim:PhaseTapChangerSymmetrical and cim:PhaseTapChangerAsymmetrical, the value of cim:TapChanger.step should not deviate more than SSH_SV_MAX_TAP_STEP_DIFF from the value of cim:SvTapStep.position
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Considering the Power Flow settings, the tap position shift should be minimal. The SSH data should be based on a solved power flow (CGMM) and as a consequence, the values in SSH (input) and SV (calculation results) should not be far away.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Starting tap position deviates more than 2 from calculated tap position

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: ShuntQ
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:LinearShuntCompensator, the value of cim:SvPowerFlow.q should not deviate more than SSH_SV_MAX_Q_SHUNT_DIFF MVAr from the negated product of the value of cim:SvShuntCompensatorSections.sections, the value of cim:LinearShuntCompensator.bPerSection and the squared value of cim:SvVoltage.v at the cim:TopologicalNode, the cim:LinearShuntCompensator is connected to.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Unrealistic reactive power in SV for cim:LinearShuntCompensator, assumed reactive power infeed deviates from calculated more than SSH_SV_MAX_Q_SHUNT_DIFF

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: SvInjectionLimit
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The absolute values of cim:SvInjection.pInjection and cim:SvInjection.qInjection shall be less than the SV_INJECTION_LIMIT MW/MVar. In instance of cim:SvInjection is only needed if the limit is breached.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The cim:SvInjection values gives the accuracy of the power flow solution. Large values of cim:SvInjection.pInjection and cim:SvInjection.qInjection indicates a poorly converged power flow solution. Lots of cim:SvInjection instances below limit will clutter the SV file.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Power flow convergence mismatch not within limit, greater than SV_INJECTION_LIMIT MW/MVar

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: VoltageProfile
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Where a cim:VoltageLimit exists for an energized cim:TopologicalNode, the value of cim:SvVoltage.v should be lower than or equal to the value of cim:VoltageLimit.value associated with cim:OperationalLimitType.limitType=highVoltage and higher than or equal to the value of cim:VoltageLimit.value associated with cim:OperationalLimitType.limitType=lowVoltage. In case of multiple limits the most restrictive shall be used.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Considering the Power Flow settings, all voltages should be within defined operational limits. See IEC TS 61970-600-2:2017 section 6.8.7.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Calculated voltage out of range

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: VoltageTargetsAtTN
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For all cim:RegulatingControl (including its subclass cim:TapchangerControl) instances at a cim:TopologicalNode their cim:RegulatingControl.targetValues should be equal.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The power flow solver need a single voltage target per cim:TopologicalNode and the cim:RegulatingControl.targetValues differ the power flow will have to pick a value. If different Power Flow applications use different strategies to pick a value the voltage solution will differ between them which is the reason to warn.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Voltage targets differ

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: VoltageTargetAndDeadbandAtTN
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For all cim:RegulatingControl (including its subclass cim:TapchangerControl) instances at a cim:TopologicalNode whith one or more cim:RegulatingControls having discrete="true" the following is valid - For a RCC with cim:RegulatingControl.discrete="true" the range is {cim:RegulatingControl.targetValue - cim:RegulatingControl.targetDeadband/2, cim:RegulatingControl.targetValue + cim:RegulatingControl.targetDeadband/2} - The ranges for different cim:RegulatingControl instances shall be overlapping so the cim:RegulatingControl.targetValue is inside the range of all cim:RegulatingControls - For a RCC with cim:RegulatingControl.discrete="false" the cim:RegulatingControl.targetValue shall be within all the present cim:RegulatingControl ranges.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: The power flow solver need a single deadband per cim:TopologicalNode and if the deadbands differ the power flow will have to pick a value. If different Power Flow applications use different strategies to pick a value the voltage solution will differ between them which is the reason to warn.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Voltage targets differ

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: EnergizedBoundaryTN
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: A boundary cim:TopologicalNode with a non-zero cim:EquivalentInjection.p or cim:EquivalentInjection.q is supposed to be energized and shall have a solved voltage, i.e. cim:SvVoltage.v shall not be zero.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: All boundary cim:TopologicalNodes in a power flow model shall have a solved voltage.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Boundary cim:TopologicalNode with injecting cim:EquivalentInjection without solved cim:SvVoltage.v

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: FakeVoltage
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: A cim:TopologicalNode with a solved voltage equal to the cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage is suspected to copy that value rather than solving to power flow.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: This is to prevent from faking the voltage.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Voltage at cim:TopologicalNode may be fake

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: InvalidVoltage
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: A cim:SvVoltage lower than 0.4 per unit and greater than 0 is not allowed.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: A cim:SvVoltage lower than 0.4 per unit and greater than 0 is not reasonable.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: A cim:SvVoltage lower than 0.4 per unit and greater than 0 is not allowed

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: DiscreteControl
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:RegulatingControl (SSH) for which the value of cim:RegulatingControl.discrete is true and cim:RegulatingControl.enabled is true the control variables must move in discrete steps. Hence no decimals are allowed for the following attributes values - cim:ShuntCompensator.sections - related cim:SvShuntCompensatorSections.sections - cim:TapChanger.step - related cim:SvTapStep.position
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: If cim:RegulatingControl.discrete is set to true it is not possible to move the control variables continuously.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:ShuntCompensator.sections or cim:TapChanger.step or SvShuntCompensatorSection.sections or SvTapStep.position shall be an integer value in discrete control.

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: ContinuousControl
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every instance of cim:RegulatingControl (SSH) for which the value of cim:RegulatingControl.discrete is false and cim:RegulatingControl.enabled is true means continuous control. For devices natively being discrete this means an imprecise modelling of the behaviour for - cim:ShuntCompensator - cim:TapChanger
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: If cim:RegulatingControl.discrete is false continuous control is used which is an imprecise model. For as built equipment the most precise model should be used.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:ShuntCompensator or cim:TapChanger should not be used with continuous control

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: RequiredSvVoltage
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Instances of cim:SvVoltage is required for all cim:TopologicalNodes. If power flow didn't create a solution for a cim:TopologicalNode cim:SvVoltage angle and voltage shall be set to zero.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Instances of cim:SvVoltage is required to know where power flow managed to solve.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:SvVoltage is missing for cim:TopologicalNode

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: RequiredSvSCSections
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Instances of cim:SvShuntCompensatorSections is required for all shunt compensators. The shunt compensators are instances of subclasses to cim:ShuntCompensator. For a shunt compensator that is not used in control by power flow the value of SvShuntCompensatorSections.sections shall be the same as cim:ShuntCompensator.sections.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Instances of cim:SvShuntCompensatorSections is required to tell the number of sections that was used in the solution.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:SvShuntCompensatorSections is missing for shunt compensator

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: RequiredSvTapStep
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: Instances of cim:SvTapStep is required for all tap changers. The tap changers are instances of subclasses to cim:TapChanger. For a tap changer that is not used in control by power flow the value of SvTapStep.step shall be the same as cim:TapChanger.step.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Instances of cim:SvTapStep is required to tell the step number that was used in the solution.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: cim:SvTapStep is missing for tap changer

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: InconsistentCurrentLimits
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: The value of cim:CurrentLimit.value is expected to be the same for a tie line on both sides of the boundary point. The lowest limit shall be used in studies.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: Tie line data is supposed to be coordinated by TSOs.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Current limits are inconsistent at tie line

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: UnpairedTieFlow
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: A boundary cim:TopologicalNode (AC) in a CGM may be connected to 1) two branches and two cim:EquivalentInjections linking two IGMs 2) one branch and one cim:EquivalentInjection terminating the IGM. In case 1) the cim:EquivalentInjections shall have p/q values equal zero (no transfer of power) or different from zero (transfer of power). Having zero values on one side and non-zero on the other indicates different assumptions on usage of the tie line. In case 2) the cim:EquivalentInjection p and q values are injections representing the tie line power flow. Note: An HVDC Boundary Point has a cim:IdentifiedObject.description attribute with leading chracters equal to 'HVDC'
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: cim:TieFlow is typically calculated at the AC Tie Line terminal, connected to the boundary point for AC Tie Lines (regardless of its position on the Tie line) and at the Point of Common Coupling for HVDC links
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: Tie lines at the boundary have different operational status

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: ACTielineBV
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For a cim:ControlArea of type interchange all cim:TieFlow branches, not connected to an HVDC boundary point, shall have a cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage that deviates no more than BOUNDARY_BV_MAX_DIFF from the cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage of the boundary point. Note: An HVDC Boundary Point has a cim:IdentifiedObject.description attribute equal to 'HVDC'.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: See section 6.10.2 of IEC TS 61970-600-2:2017
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: AC Tie line nominalVoltages deviates from the boundary point base voltage more than BOUNDARY_BV_MAX_DIFF

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: ACScheduleMatch1
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every Terminal, designated as cim:TieFlow.Terminal belonging to a cim:ControlArea of type Interchange, connected to an AC Boundary cim:TopologicalNode, the aggregated cim:SvPowerFlow.p tie flows should match the value of the external AC schedule with the same cim:ControlArea EIC 'Y' code within INTERCH_IMBALANCE_WARNING MW threshold. Note: An HVDC Boundary cim:TopologicalNode has a cim:IdentifiedObject.description attribute with leading characters 'HVDC'.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: In the Reporting Information Market Document, issued by PEVF or CGMA, the EIC 'Y' code is found in the domain.mRID, in the IGM it is the value of attribute entsoe:IdentifiedObject.EnergyIdentCodeEic for the ControlArea instance.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: AC tie flows doesn't match the scheduled interchange value more than INTERCH_IMBALANCE_WARNING MW

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: ACScheduleMatch2
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every cim:Terminal, designated as cim:TieFlow.Terminal belonging to a cim:ControlArea of type Interchange, connected to an AC Boundary cim:TopologicalNode, the aggregated cim:SvPowerFlow.p tie flows should match the value of the external AC schedule with the same cim:ControlArea EIC 'Y' code within INTERCH_IMBALANCE_ERROR MW threshold. Note: An HVDC Boundary TopologicalNode has a cim:IdentifiedObject.description attribute with leading characters 'HVDC'.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: In the Reporting Information Market Document, issued by PEVF or CGMA, the EIC 'Y' code is found in the domain.mRID, in the IGM it is the value of attribute entsoe:IdentifiedObject.EnergyIdentCodeEic for the ControlArea instance.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: AC tie flows doesn't match the scheduled interchange values more than INTERCH_IMBALANCE_ERROR MW

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: HVDCScheduleMatch1
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every cim:Terminal, designated as cim:TieFlow.Terminal belonging to a cim:ControlArea of type Interchange, connected to an HVDC Boundary cim:TopologicalNode, the cim:SvPowerFlow.p value should match the value of the external schedule for the same cim:ControlArea EIC 'Y' code and with the same connectingLine_RegisteredResource EIC 'T' code within INTERCH_IMBALANCE_WARNING MW threshold. If the value of cim:SvPowerFlow.p is not exchanged for said cim:Terminal, the negated sum of the cim:SvPowerFlow.p values associated with the same cim:TopologicalNode is to be used instead, following Kirchhoff's Current Law. Note: An HVDC Boundary cim:TopologicalNode has a cim:IdentifiedObject.description attribute with leading characters 'HVDC'.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: In the Reporting Information Market Document, issued by PEVF or CGMA, the EIC 'Y' code is found in the domain.mRID, in the IGM it is the value of attribute entsoe:IdentifiedObject.EnergyIdentCodeEic for the cim:ControlArea instance. The EIC 'T' code is found in the TimeSeries in the connectingLine_RegisteredResource.mRID, in the IGM it is the value of attribute entsoe:IdentifiedObject.EnergyIdentCodeEic for the Boundary point instance, the terminal is connected to.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: HVDC flow doesn't match the scheduled interchange value more than INTERCH_IMBALANCE_WARNING MW

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: HVDCScheduleMatch2
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every cim:Terminal, designated as cim:TieFlow.Terminal belonging to a cim:ControlArea of type Interchange, connected to an HVDC Boundary cim:TopologicalNode, the cim:SvPowerFlow.p value should match the value of the external schedule for the same cim:ControlArea EIC 'Y' code and with the same connectingLine_RegisteredResource EIC 'T' code within INTERCH_IMBALANCE_ERROR MW threshold. If the value of cim:SvPowerFlow.p is not exchanged for said cim:Terminal, the negated sum of the cim:SvPowerFlow.p values associated with the same cim:TopologicalNode is to be used instead, following Kirchhoff's Current Law. Note: An HVDC Boundary cim:TopologicalNode has a cim:IdentifiedObject.description attribute with leading characters 'HVDC'.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.justification: In the Reporting Information Market Document, issued by PEVF or CGMA, the EIC 'Y' code is found in the domain.mRID, in the IGM it is the value of attribute entsoe:IdentifiedObject.EnergyIdentCodeEic for the cim:ControlArea instance. The EIC 'T' code is found in the TimeSeries in the connectingLine_RegisteredResource.mRID, in the IGM it is the value of attribute entsoe:IdentifiedObject.EnergyIdentCodeEic for the Boundary point instance, the terminal is connected to.
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.message: HVDC flow doesn't match the scheduled interchange value more than INTERCH_IMBALANCE_ERROR MW

cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.name: NetInterchangeMatch1
cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.cgmbp:UMLRestrictionRule.description: For every cim:ControlArea of type interchange, the value of cim:ControlArea.netInterchange should not deviate more than INTERCH_IMBALANCE_WARNING MW from the sum of the netted area AC and DC positions in the aggregated netted external shedules (PEVF or CGMA) for the same scenarioTime and with the same EIC 'Y' code.
